page.title: 01Southport, an introduction
page.content: Southport is a holiday resort on the Lancashire coast. It has a population of 90,000 and is situated on a largely flat landscape containing many sandhills. It is a dormitory town for commuters to Liverpool and Manchester. There is very little industry apart from tourism. The Southport theatre is a venue for concerts and shows by international stars. Other attractions of the town include a model village, fairground, boating lake, zoo, swimming pools, parks, shopping and of course the beach. Accommodation ranges from small guest houses to large hotels and self catering holiday flats. Owing to the large proportion of elderly people there are many retirement homes.
